meanings.definition: Cancel or refrain from exacting or inflicting (a debt or punishment)
meanings.sent1: He remits the fine for the parking ticket.
meanings.sent2: She always remits the late fee for her library books.
meanings.sent3: The judge decided to remit the penalty for the minor offense.
meanings.sent4: The teacher kindly remits the homework assignment for the sick student.
meanings.sent5: The company policy allows employees to remit any overdue fees under certain circumstances.

meanings.definition: Send (money) in payment or as a gift
meanings.sent1: Every month, he remits a portion of his salary to his family back home.
meanings.sent2: She remits a small donation to the charity every year.
meanings.sent3: He decided to remit some money to his friend as a surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: The generous donor remits a large sum to support the local community.
meanings.sent5: The company remits bonuses to employees for their hard work.

meanings.sent1: The bank remits the funds to the recipient's account promptly.
meanings.sent2: She remits the payment for the online purchase using her credit card.
meanings.sent3: The customer remits the amount owed for the services rendered.
meanings.sent4: The company remits the salary to its employees on the last working day of the month.
meanings.sent5: He remits the rent to the landlord through online banking.
